name: Peggy Rajski
biography: Peggy M. Rajski is an American filmmaker, best known for directing and co-producing the 1994 American short film Trevor, which won an Academy Award for "Best Live Action Short Film" at the 67th Annual Academy Awards in 1995. She is also a co-founder of The Trevor Project, a crisis-intervention organization for LGBTQ+ youth, and an academic who has taught producing and filmmaking. From June 2018 to March 2021, Rajski was dean of the Loyola Marymount University School of Film and Television in Los Angeles, California.  In November 2022 she became Interim CEO of The Trevor Project.
